page.title: 03Education
page.content: Education is compulsory for children from the age of five to 16 and is provided free by the Local Education Authority of the Norfolk County Council. Fee paying Education is also available. Five year old children in Dereham attend one of three First Schools, Dereham Church School (121 pupils) Kings Park School (106 pupils) and The Grove School (126 pupils). At eight they transfer to Dereham Church Middle School (410 pupils) until 12 years old. Children from Dereham and the surrounding villages will attend one of two High Schools which cater for 12 to 16 year olds. The Neatherd High School has 640 on roll and Northgate High School 780. Some continue their education until 18 at The Sixth Form Centre. Adult Education is organised at Northgate School in the evenings.
